section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Noise Control (General) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Completion of forms under regulations 3 and 4
section.leadIn: A form prescribed under regulations 3 and 4 shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed legibly by the person submitting the form; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the person submitting the form is an individual acting on his own behalf or as a partner on behalf of a partnership, by that individual; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the person submitting the form is a body corporate, by an individual authorized in that behalf by that body corporate.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application for construction noise permit for construction work other than percussive piling

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 8(2) of the Ordinance for a construction noise permit for either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of powered mechanical equipment for the purpose of carrying out construction work other than percussive piling between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m., or at any time on a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the carrying out of prescribed construction work at any place within a designated area between such hours, or at any such time,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in Form 1 in the Schedule; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: submitted to the Authority together with the fee prescribed by regulation 8(1) not earlier than 6 months prior to the date specified in the application for commencement of the construction work unless the Authority agrees to accept submission of the application at an earlier time.

subsection.def: In this regulation and the Schedule, prescribed construction work (訂明建築工程) means the construction work prescribed by the Noise Control (Construction Work) Regulation (Cap. 400 sub. leg. G) for the purposes of section 6(2) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application for construction noise permit for percussive piling
section.leadIn: An application under section 8(2) of the Ordinance for a construction noise permit for the purpose of carrying out percussive piling between the hours of 7 a.m. and 7 p.m. on any day, not being a general holiday, shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Form 2 in the Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submitted to the Authority together with the fee prescribed in regulation 8 not earlier than 9 months prior to the date specified in the application for the commencement of the percussive piling unless the Authority agrees to accept submission of the application at an earlier time.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of an application referred to in regulation 3, shall be in Form 3 in the Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of an application referred to in regulation 4, shall be in Form 4 in the Schedule.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Form of noise abatement notice
section.content: A noise abatement notice served under section 13(1) of the Ordinance shall be in Form 5 in the Schedule.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Form of notice cancelling a noise abatement notice or varying any requirement therein
section.leadIn: A notice served under section 13(4) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancelling a noise abatement notice shall be in Form 6 in the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: varying any requirement in a noise abatement notice shall be in Form 7 in the Schedule.

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Form of notice requiring a product to be measured, inspected or tested
section.content: A notice served under section 16(1) of the Ordinance shall be in Form 8 in the Schedule.

section.name: s7B
section.heading: Form of notice cancelling a notice requiring a product to be measured, inspected or tested, or varying any requirement therein
section.leadIn: A notice served under section 16(3) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancelling a notice requiring a product to be measured, inspected or tested shall be in Form 9 in the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: varying any requirement in a notice requiring a product to be measured, inspected or tested shall be in Form 10 in the Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Fees payable on application for a construction noise permit

subsection.content: The fee payable on application for a construction noise permit referred to in regulation 3 shall be $2,610.
The fee payable on application for a construction noise permit referred to in regulation 4 shall be $1,980.

tr.td: Specify any particularly quiet percussive piling methods or any special noise control measures to be employed on site, or any other special factors or exceptional circumstances which are thought to be relevant.
Give any additional information which is thought to be relevant to this application.

The applicant is advised to read the Noise Control Ordinance, the Noise Control (General) Regulations and the Technical Memorandum on Noise from Percussive Piling before submitting this application. The Authority shall be guided by the Technical Memorandum in considering an application.

Section 8(4) of the Ordinance provides that not later than 28 days after an application is received by the Authority, he shall issue a construction noise permit or serve on the applicant written notice of his refusal to issue the permit, and if at the end of those 28 days he has done neither of those things a permit shall be deemed to have been issued.
A construction noise permit that is issued in consequence of misleading, false, wrong or incomplete information furnished by an applicant in connection with the application is liable to be cancelled.
The fee payable on submission of this application will not be refunded.
